title: Auto-collapse of Connection tab does not work if clicked on Connection tab.
author: igor2x
body_snippet:
I have been using mRemoteNG for years. Currently I am using mRemoteNG officially stable version 1.76.20 on Windows 10.
    1. Open SSH connection to e.g. Linux computer and do some tasks.
    2. Move mouse to top left and position it on Connections horizontal tab. Do not click on Connections tab. Connection tab is expended. Now move mouse back rigth on "black" terminal background and "Connection" tab is collapsed.
    3. Now move mouse to top left position again and now click on Connections. ...

comments.snippet: Can you add some screenshots to better explain what you are describing?
comments.author: BlueBlock

comments.snippet:
- On left site "Connections" tab is collapsed. Click on Connection tab (red arrow).
- Move mouse to right outside of "Connection" menu like to letter "B". I expect Connection tab to be auto-collapsed back to original state (like in left site of image), but it stats displayed like on right site of image for ever. I expect this to happen only if I pin the Connection dialog, but I didn't.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10895030/227775628-fde0345a-300e-439a-aa86-09caf9a86b6a.pn...
comments.author: igor2x

comments.snippet:
Thanks for the screenshots, that helps.

It can be changed, it looks like the current behavior is standard though. Visual Studio uses the same tab design and an expanded tab does not auto-close until a click outside of the tab occurs or another click on the tab.
comments.author: BlueBlock

comments.snippet:
I am not using Visual Studio or any other tool having the same functionality, so I don't have experience what is the best behavior in this case.

Maybe:
- At least what I would like is when I click outside of Connection menu (like on black background terminal), the Connection menu would auto-collapse.
- It would also be nice when Connection menu is displayed, when I click on "Connection" tab the connection would collapse. Clicking again it would display again. Like a toggle button. Sometimes...
comments.author: igor2x

comments.snippet:
My reference to Visual Studio is simply to show the behavior is standard. That doesn't mean it needs to be that way, but it generally means users expect that behavior.

The tab can certainly be set to collapse again if the mouse exits the tab area. 
Though some possibly problems are created with that, such as if MR is being run remotely and on a slow connection. If the user is not able to keep the mouse in the tab area, it closes.

What if pressing Esc closes the tab? That would be behavior...
comments.author: BlueBlock

comments.snippet:
I don't know if I am really a fan of Esc key. Maybe user presses Esc thinking Connection menu is going to collapse, but immediately pressing Esc menu does not collapses and presses Esc one more time, but this time terminal may accept Esc key and some task may be canceled. I would probably not be pressing Esc just in case...

What about adding small arrow button icon at the edge of Connection menu. When pressing the button the Connection menu would collapse.

LibreOffice has something similar...
comments.author: igor2x

comments.snippet:
Interesting... I did some more tests. If I click on terminal window (black terminal background) Connection menu does collapses, but it takes like more then a second to collapse.

Maybe all what should be done is just remove this one second lag after clicking on black terminal background and instead Connection menu to collapse immediately without any delay.
comments.author: igor2x

comments.snippet: Regarding adding an arrow, why not just click on the vertical tab name again?
comments.author: BlueBlock

comments.snippet: Clicking on vertical tab name when Connection menu is extracted to collapse Connection menu would be great. Currently clicking on vertical tab name when Connection menu is extracted, does not collapses Connection menu.
comments.author: igor2x
